Posts.Content: Nedlewrkr76 wrote: Hello everyone, I just had my first mammogram last week (15th) and the next day the center called me back to tell me I needed a diagnostic mammogram and ultrasound. I was not able to get much information from the woman on the phone because I was traveling at the time. Basically she just said that they found something abnormal and that they wanted to check it out. She then asked me if I was driving, and when I told her I was in the car but my daughter was driving, the call disconnected. I'm sure that was just because of the cell service, but it did freak me out a bit. I called my doctor to get her to call in a referral that afternoon. It took them until today to get back to me and get a diagnostic mammogram scheduled (no ultrasound like I was told from the screening center). So that appointment is on the 31st. In the meantime, the radiologist put the result up. To be completely honest I am confused about the wording that was used. "an area of possible nodularity likely in the upper outer quadrant located 13 cm from the nipple". I am trying not to worry because I know the odds are that there is nothing wrong. I actually feel silly even posting this when so many others have more serious concerns. BTW, I am 40yrs old and a mother of 2 teen girls. The report said that my breasts have scattered fibroglandular tissue. I was also told that since my boobs were so large that they would have to do extra images. (i think they did 8 total) Thank you all for listening to my ramblings. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Waiting and Wondering and slighty worried Nedlewrkr76 djmammo

Posts.Content: Mar 22, 2017 06:24PM Nedlewrkr76 wrote: Thank you both for taking the time to write! I have read all of the statistics and know the odds are good. Sometimes my mind runs to the worst case scenario. It definitely helps to get it off my chest, so to speak. I am trying to not think too much until I have the next test done. And hopefully i will get the "nothing to worry about". :)
